entry.title: Amen break (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Amen break (pictured) gained popularity because it offered an easy way to create jungle music?

entry.title: Soumane Touré (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the execution of Burkinabé trade union leader Soumane Touré was prevented by the intervention of his childhood friend, then-president Thomas Sankara?

entry.title: The Amazing Digital Circus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that The Amazing Digital Circus is influenced by the short story "I Have No Mouth, and I Must Scream"?

entry.title: Jaelyn Brown (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jaelyn Brown, who was born with two club feet, now plays in the WNBA?

entry.title: sitdown strikes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the U.S. Department of Labor recorded 583 sitdown strikes in the U.S. between 1936 and 1939, affecting half a million workers?

entry.title: Vasantha Krishna Prasad (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Vasantha Krishna Prasad was the richest candidate from Krishna district to contest the 2019 Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly election?

entry.title: The End of Everything (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Megan Abbott receives the most negative letters from readers for The End of Everything?

entry.title: Madisen Skinner (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that volleyball player Madisen Skinner beat Texas in one national championship final – then won two national championships with Texas?

entry.title: Gravity Blanket (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Gravity Blanket was funded by a crowdfunding campaign which raised more than $4.7 million, despite asking for only $21,500?
